intro: Blaeria ciliciiflora, commonly known as the Cyprus blaeria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate. Its foliage is aromatic and has been historically used in traditional medicine. Blaeria ciliciiflora is considered a rare and endemic species, contributing to the unique biodiversity of Cyprus.
